entries.meaning: A large horned animal in ancient Hebrew literature, variously identified with the wild ox or aurochs (Bos primigenius), the Arabian oryx, or a mythical creature (compare unicorn).

description: Compare ream (“to make a hole in”).

verbs.description: reem (third-person singular simple present reems, present participle reeming, simple past and past participle reemed)

entries.meaning: (transitive, nautical) To open (the seams of a vessel's planking) for the purpose of calking them.

description: Of unclear origins, popularised by Joey Essex. Possibly derived from cream or ream.

adjectives.description: reem (comparative reemer or more reem, superlative reemest or most reem)

entries.meaning: (UK, chiefly Essex, slang) cool, excellent; desirable; sexy.
examples: The cast of The Only Way Is Essex have tried every fake tan in the universe and insist this is best before a reem night out.
